Package gov.nih.nlm.ling.core

Class SpanList

  • java.lang.Object
    • gov.nih.nlm.ling.core.SpanList
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<SpanList>
    public class SpanList
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable<SpanList>
    Represents the character offsets of a linguistic object. It consists of a List of Span objects, which are assumed to be in ascending order. This class allows handling multi-part linguistic objects. This class also provides methods to compare the positions of two SpanList objects.
    Author:
    Halil Kilicoglu

        end - the end offset

      • SpanList

        public SpanList​(java.lang.String charOffset)
        Creates a SpanList object from a String representation. (X-Y;W-Z) format is assumed.
        Parameters:
        charOffset - a String representation of a multi-part span.

      • SpanList

        public SpanList​(java.lang.String charOffset,
                char separator,
                char spanSeparator)
        Creates a SpanList object from a String representation.
        Parameters:
        charOffset - a String representation of a multi-part span.
        separator - delimiter for spans
        spanSeparator - delimiter for begin/end offsets for each span

      • intersection

        public static SpanList intersection​(SpanList s1,
                                    SpanList s2)
        Takes the intersection of two SpanList objects. The spans of the resulting SpanList are in ascending order.
        Parameters:
        s1 - the first SpanList object
        s2 - the second
        Returns:
        the intersection of s1 and s2

      • union

        public static SpanList union​(SpanList s1,
                             SpanList s2)
        Takes the union of two SpanList objects. The spans of the resulting SpanList are in ascending order.
        Parameters:
        s1 - the first SpanList object
        s2 - the second
        Returns:
        the union of s1 and s2

      • union

        public static SpanList union​(java.util.List<SpanList> spls)
        Similar to union(SpanList, SpanList), but takes as input a list of SpanList objects.
        Parameters:
        spls - a list of SpanList objects
        Returns:
        the union of all spans in the list

      • overlap

        public static boolean overlap​(SpanList s1,
                              SpanList s2)
        Determines whether two multi-part span objects overlap.
        Parameters:
        s1 - the first SpanList object
        s2 - the second SpanList object
        Returns:
        true if the SpanList objects have overlap

      • subsume

        public static boolean subsume​(SpanList s1,
                              SpanList s2)
        Determines whether the first SpanList object subsumes the second completely.
        Parameters:
        s1 - the first SpanList object
        s2 - the second SpanList object
        Returns:
        true if s1 subsumes s2.

      • atLeft

        public static boolean atLeft​(SpanList s1,
                             SpanList s2)
        Determines whether the first SpanList object is to the left of the second in its entirety.
        Parameters:
        s1 - the first SpanList object
        s2 - the second SpanList object
        Returns:
        true if s1 is to the left of s2.

      • invalidSpan

        public static boolean invalidSpan​(SpanList sp)
        Parameters:
        sp - a SpanList object
        Returns:
        true if the SpanList object is invalid (for at least one of the spans, begin position is to the right of the end position)
